titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Sass Nielson papers 1974-1976 LSC.2162
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2013; Sabrina Ponce, 2017; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 29 November 2017.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-29T11:28-0800

did.abstract: Sass Nielsen worked at Disney Studios in Burbank, California throughout the 1990s. Her advocacy work, growing out of the group Hollywood Supports (a nonprofit organization promoting awareness of AIDS and gay issues) concerned the extension of health benefits for same sex partners as well as organizing around lesbian and gay issues in the workplace. In 1992, she successfully organized to form the Lesbian and Gay United Employees (LEAGUE). This collection includes research, correspondence, and collected materials related to gay and lesbian issues including information from activist organizations as well as publications treating the issue historically.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sass Nielsen papers (Collection 2162). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Processed by Stacy Wood, 2012. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2017.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Sass Nielsen worked at Disney Studios in Burbank, California throughout the 1990s. Her advocacy work, growing out of the group Hollywood Supports (a nonprofit organization promoting awareness of AIDS and gay issues) concerned the extension of health benefits for same sex partners as well as organizing around lesbian and gay issues in the workplace. In 1992, she successfully organized to form the Lesbian and Gay United Employees (LEAGUE). As a young woman she was kicked out of the armed forces for being a lesbian. She also wrote fiction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection includes research, correspondence, and collected materials related to gay and lesbian issues including information from activist organizations as well as publications treating the issue historically.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.
controlaccess.subject: Gay rights--United States.
Lesbian activists--United States--Archives.

did.unittitle: Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Brochures, flyers and letters from the Lambda Legal Defense Fund.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Clippings and publications including It's Time: Monthly Newsletter of the National Gay Task Force and Gayzette: The Weekly Philadelphia Gayzette.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Conference schedules, biographies and abstracts of participants of the 1974 Gay Academic Union Conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collected letters from individuals and organizations concerning various issues related to gay and lesbian feminist activism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Feminist and activist works published by other authors and collected by Sass Nielsen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: How-to guides, samples of consciousness raising techniques.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Information about women's programming including conferences, series and activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Resources including catalogs, contact information, brochures and pamphlets about available resources and group opportunities from gay and lesbian activist organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Surveys about sexual experience and relationships.
